content.title: Mukhyamantri Samajik Sahayata Prakalpa - Unorganized Workers
content.department: Directorate of Social Welfare and Social Education
content.details: The scheme 'Mukhyamantri Samajik Sahayata Prakalpa- Unorganized Workers' is a Pension Scheme launched by the Directorate of Social Welfare and Social Education, Government of Tripura. The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance to the Unorganized Workers (home-based workers, self-employed workers or wage workers) in the unorganized sector.
benefits: A pension amount of ₹2,000/- per month.
The sanctioned grant will be transferred directly to the individual bank account of the applicant.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Tripura.
The annual income of the family of the applicant should not exceed ₹1,00,000/-.
The age of the applicant should be 55 years and above (except for ‘Greha Sahayika’).
In the case of ‘Greha Shahayika’ (Female Domestic Worker), the age of the applicant should be between 23 to 59 years.
If the family has children in the age group of 6 to 14 years, those children must be enrolled in a school recognized by the Government of Tripura.
exclusions: Individuals whose family members are already getting benefits under any of the Category/Sub-Category under ‘Mukhyamantri Samajik Sahayata Prakalpa' (except infirm & PwDs) are not eligible.

Pensioners who are getting benefits under the 'National Social Assistance Program (NSAP)' or the 32 State Social Pension Schemes run by the Social Welfare & Social Education Department, Govt. of Tripura are not eligible.
content.application_process: Offline and Online. Applicants should visit the Office of the Child Development Project Officer to request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form or take a print of the prescribed format from the official website.
documents_required: Income Certificate from SDM (Sub Divisional Magistrate).
Age Proof Certificate (Birth Certificate/ School Certificate/ Madhyamik Admit).
Ration Card, issued by the Food & Civil Supplies Department.
Permanent Resident of Tripura Certificate (PRTC), issued by the Sub Divisional Administration.
Professional Certificate from Gram Panchayat/ Village Committee/ Nagar Panchayat/ AMC Chairman.
Non-Government Employee Certificate from Panchayat Secretary/Ward Secretary/Gazetted Officer.

faqs.question: What certificates need to be submitted after selection?
faqs.answer: After selection, beneficiaries must submit Life Certificate and Income Certificate to the CDPO in November every year.

faqs.question: What events lead to the immediate cessation of assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Assistance is stopped in cases such as the death of the beneficiary or fulfillment of exclusion criteria, including remarriage of a widow or a family member getting a Government Job.

faqs.question: What is the condition related to the enrollment of children in the family?
faqs.answer: If the family has children aged 6 to 14 years, they must be enrolled in a school recognized by the Government of Tripura.

faqs.question: What is the age range for 'Greha Shahayika' (Female Domestic Worker) applicants?
faqs.answer: The age of 'Greha Shahayika' applicants should be between 23 to 59 years.

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for applicants, excluding 'Greha Shahayika'?
faqs.answer: Applicants should be 55 years and above, except for 'Greha Shahayika' (Female Domestic Worker).

faqs.question: What is the maximum annual income limit for the family of the applicant?
faqs.answer: The annual income of the applicant's family should not exceed ₹1,00,000.

faqs.question: Where can the beneficiaries check the list of beneficiaries for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The list of beneficiaries is available on the official website of the Social Welfare & Social Education Department, Govt. of Tripura.

faqs.question: How much is the monthly pension amount provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The pension amount under the scheme is ₹2,000 per month.

faqs.question: What is the mode of disbursal for the sanctioned grant?
faqs.answer: The sanctioned grant is directly transferred to the individual bank account of the applicant.

faqs.question: How often should the Life Certificate and Income Certificate be submitted after selection?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries need to submit the Life Certificate & Income Certificate to the CDPO in November every year after selection.

faqs.question: Are there any specific criteria for children in the family to be eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Children in the age group of 6 to 14 years must be enrolled in a school recognized by the Government of Tripura for the family to be eligible.
